product_overview: Zooming CRM is a specialized customer relationship management system designed for video production companies and audiovisual agencies. It integrates sales, project lifecycle management, resource allocation, equipment inventory, freelancer management, and financial operations into a unified platform tailored to the unique needs of the audiovisual industry.
core_goals: Provide an interactive proposal system embedding multimedia portfolios and real-time option selection for enhanced client engagement.
Offer a custom Kanban pipeline reflecting audiovisual production stages (Lead to Delivery) with validations and notifications.
Enable robust equipment management with anti-conflict booking, maintenance tracking, and ROI analysis.
Maintain a comprehensive freelancer talent bank with skills, availability, ratings, and automatic allocation notifications.
Implement a financial management system fully integrated with proposals and freelancer payments, supporting receivables and payables.
Secure user authentication and multi-tenancy support for organizations with role-based access control.
Deliver a dashboard with key performance indicators and insights on projects, finances, and resources.
Implement a global search feature across all modules for efficient navigation.
key_features: Complete user authentication system with email/password login, user registration, and role-based access.
Full CRUD operations for clients, projects, freelancers, and equipment with detailed attributes.
Advanced project management featuring multiple shooting and delivery dates, Kanban board visualization, team allocation, and equipment booking.
Interactive proposal builder supporting items, optionals, embedded portfolio videos, payment schedules, and public sharing links.
Financial system with transaction tracking, accounts receivable/payable, cash flow dashboard, and automatic integrations triggered by proposals and freelancer allocations.
Reservation system for equipment with conflict detection and calendar availability visualization.
Freelancer management with customizable rates, ratings, availability calendars, and automatic payable integration.
Media approval workflow allowing clients to review and approve video revisions directly within the system.
Dashboard displaying KPIs, recent projects, shooting schedules, and financial metrics for a comprehensive overview.
Unified global search functionality covering all modules with quick navigation results.
user_flow_summary: User registers or logs into the system with appropriate organizational context and role-based permissions.
User creates and manages clients and projects, including adding multiple shooting and delivery dates, assigning teams, and booking equipment.
User builds proposals with interactive items, optional services, portfolio videos, and payment schedules; sends proposals via unique public tokens.
Clients access public proposal pages, select optional services, and accept or reject proposals, triggering financial receivable creation.
Users allocate freelancers with custom rates to projects, automatically syncing payable transactions for accurate financial tracking.
Users manage equipment bookings with visual calendars and conflict alerts to avoid double reservations.
Users monitor project status via the Kanban board and overview tables highlighting delayed items.
Users review and approve or request changes on video deliverables through secure review pages, advancing project stages automatically.
Users track financial dashboards, handle transactions, and reconcile accounts receivable/payable generated from proposals and freelancer allocations.
validation_criteria: All CRUD operations must respect multi-tenancy with organization scoping and role-based permissions.
Proposal builder must correctly calculate totals with discounts and optionals, validate payment schedules (sum of percentages <= 100%), and maintain versioning.
Integration triggers must ensure creation and updates of financial transactions upon freelancer allocations and proposal acceptance.
Equipment booking system must prevent double-bookings on overlapping dates and display conflicts clearly.
Clients accessing proposal or review links must have secure token-based access and perform actions only allowed by status.
User interface must implement responsive design, inline validation forms with clear error messages, and smooth animations using Framer Motion.
Automated tests or manual test scenarios must verify creation and management flows for projects with multiple dates, freelancer allocations, financial transactions linkage, and proposal acceptance.
Security must enforce Supabase Auth, RLS policies, and secure server actions to prevent unauthorized data exposure or manipulation.
